parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: From a compound of the base of homou and logos; to assent, i.e. Covenant, acknowledge.
A deity, especially the supreme Divinity; figuratively, a magistrate; by Hebraism, very.
A primary particle; but, and, etc.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Middle or Passive - 3rd Person Plural
str2: Perhaps from a and the middle voice of rheo; to contradict, i.e. Disavow, reject, abnegate.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From a primary ergo; toil; by implication, an act.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.
Abominable, detestable. From bdelusso; detestable, i.e. idolatrous.
Unbelieving, disobedient, who will not be persuaded. Unpersuadable, i.e. Contumacious.
Failing to pass the test, unapproved, counterfeit. By implication, worthless.
To, towards, with. A strengthened form of pro; a preposition of direction; forward to, i.e. Toward.
All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.
From a primary ergo; toil; by implication, an act.
